definition: to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to lose/to throw away/to discard/to cast away
to tear down/to destroy/to dismantle (a gang)/to abort (a fetus)
to get rid of/to exclude/to eliminate/to remove/to delete/to strip out/to extract
to turn one's head/to turn round/to turn about
to remove/to take off/to strip off/to discard/to shed/to come off/to fall off
treat sth lightly/to lower one's guard

sentences.english: " You this bag is very special, fell into the water and no water wet".
sentences.chinese: “你这个包还真是很特别，掉进水里也没进水湿掉”。

sentences.english: He killed off the whole morning by listening to the music.
sentences.chinese: 他通过听音乐消磨掉了整个上午的时光。

sentences.english: With more forests being destoryed, huge quantities of good earth are washed away each year.
sentences.chinese: 由于更多森林被破坏，每年有大量的好土壤流失掉了。

sentences.english: Do you think matches striking causes pineapple to fall.
sentences.chinese: 你们认为划火柴导致菠萝掉下？

sentences.english: That’s how negative people could drain your positive energy.
sentences.chinese: 这就是消极的人如何打消掉你的积极性了。
用掉是另一个尴尬的用词。

sentences.english: It is possible to trim off any blank area after printing.
sentences.chinese: 地图印刷完毕后，可将空白部分裁切掉。

sentences.english: He's had his beard shaved off.
A yardstick slides out of his pants.
sentences.chinese: 从他的裤子里掉出来了一把尺子。

sentences.english: This reduces your confidence, making you more vulnerable to your fears.
sentences.chinese: 它会腐蚀掉你的自信，使你被恐惧打败。

sentences.english: Turn that moment, www. qqtubiao5. cn can you see I dropped tears.
sentences.chinese: 回身那一刻你能否看到了我掉的泪。

sentences.english: We could go get a bowl of fish balls and wash it down with a sour plum drink.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以去喝一碗鱼丸汤，然后用酸梅汁将它消化掉。

sentences.english: The encyclopedia thudded onto the floor.
sentences.chinese: 那本百科全书砰地掉在地板上。

sentences.english: The Crow set up a loud caw and dropped the flesh.
sentences.chinese: 乌鸦张嘴大叫了一声，把肉掉了。

sentences.english: Kim Yaqian suction aspiration nose, hand- wipe the tears off his face.
sentences.chinese: 金亚倩吸吸鼻子，用手擦拭掉自己脸上的泪痕。

sentences.english: First Zheng Jiejiu has used up two challenge eagle-eyed opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 第一盘郑洁就用掉了两次挑战鹰眼的机会。

definition: to clear up/to tidy up/to dispose of
to lose/to throw away/to discard/to cast away
to get rid of/to exclude/to eliminate/to remove/to delete/to strip out/to extract

quilt/by/(indicates passive-voice clauses)/(literary) to cover/to meet with/(coll.) (since c. 2009) used before a verb that does not accurately represent what actually happened, to describe with black humor how sb or sth was dealt with by the authorities (as in 被自殺|被自杀[bei4 zi4 sha1])
direct (opposite: indirect 間接|间接[jian4 jie1])/immediate/straightforward

to come down/(completed action marker)/(after verb of motion, indicates motion down and towards us, also fig.)/(indicates continuation from the past towards us)/to be harvested (of crops)/to be over (of a period of time)/to go among the masses (said of leaders)
to throw off/to abandon/to cast off/to get rid of/to dump
to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful
